answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Gregory, 
Here is a previously answered question on the same topic with many answers and suggestions of different software and of what local governments might be helpful to get in contact with. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/kn/Question/21651
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: Sam Anselm
answers.text:
We don't use it, but Revelstone looked intriguing when I was doing similar research. It may not be exactly what you're looking for, but their website is www.revelstonelabs.com.

answers.author: Yana McConaty
answers.text:
Please consider www.neubrain.com. You can try the software by registering for an interactive trial, which also features best practice performance management and outcome (performance-based) budgeting models.  http://www.neubrain.com/Interactive-Trials

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
I have a member that is looking for examples of performance management software to measure strategic initiatives.  Any examples are greatly appreciated.
Thanks,
Greg Stopka
Central Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
title: Performance Management Software
